title: The broken rule
content:
"11. Use vulgar language, or post anything inappropriate for children. There are kids here too, remember?"

And yet everyone brakes this rule. Why is this?

Please start obeying this rule!Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
Tough guys have no table manners![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: The broken rule
content:
Well, first of all, the community isn't that young, the age is at least 15 on average. And second, I don't think there has been anything vulgar or inappropriate. And third, if the board owner, admins, or mods would see something being wrong, they would react to it.
Or would you like me to say "Remove 'Tough guys have no table manners!' from your signature, it's teaching kids inappropriate manners!" or "Don't use that furry fox as your avatar, it doesn't have clothes, only shoes!"..?Eat your veggies!

title: Re: The broken rule
content:
Bad Xtra, no biscuit!

[quote]Quote:[hr]"Don't use that furry fox as your avatar, it doesn't have clothes, only shoes!"..?[hr][/quote]

Well, finland banned Donald Duck for not wearing pants...

Harvey, just what are the bad words here? Fucl is well known here as a harmless spin off of a more offensive word, much a darn is a version of damn.

Now I suggest we make a list of offensive things:

1.) Avatars with no clothing, this includes gargs, yorps, slugs and Sonic characters.

2.) Signatures and comments advocating bad table manners, littering, short skirts and hentai.

3.) Emotikeens that advocate suicide, drug taking, rastifarians or death.

4.) The Irish.

5.) And Pakistaiani's

6.) Fucl, Skit, Heck and WTF?

7.) The number 14.

8.) Spam [and pork too.]


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord
